tool.name: plot rank abundance graph
tool.command:
plot_rank_abundance_graph.py -i $otu_table_fp -s $sample_name -o $result_fp #if $absolute_counts: -a #end if
#if $nolegend: -n #end if
#if $x_linear_scale: -x #end if
#if $y_linear_scale: -y #end if
#if str($file_type) != 'None': -f $file_type #end if

param.label: -i/--otu_table_fp: path to the input OTU table (i.e., the output from make_otu_table.py)
param.name: otu_table_fp

param.label: -s/--sample_name: name of the sample to plot. Use "*" to plot all.
param.name: sample_name

param.label: -a/--absolute_counts: plot absolute abundance values instead of relative [default: False]
param.name: absolute_counts

param.label: -n/--no-legend: do not draw a legend [default: False]
param.name: nolegend

param.label: -x/--x_linear_scale: draw x axis in linear scale [default: False]
param.name: x_linear_scale

param.label: -y/--y_linear_scale: draw y axis in linear scale [default: False]
param.name: y_linear_scale

param.label: -f/--file_type: save plot using this image type. Choice of pdf, svg, png, eps [default: pdf]
param.name: file_type

tool.help: Plot a set of rank-abundance graphs from an OTU table and a set of sample names. Multiple graphs will be plotted into the same figure, in order to allow for an easy comparison across samples.
